questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a constitution?
choices: To establish the framework for government
questions.answer: To establish the framework for government

questions.question: Which principle divides governmental authority into distinct branches?
questions.answer: Separation of powers

questions.question: What is the main purpose of the system of checks and balances?
choices: To prevent any single branch from becoming too powerful
questions.answer: To prevent any single branch from becoming too powerful

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically considered a branch of government in the separation of powers?
questions.answer: Media

questions.question: What does the concept of 'rule of law' primarily ensure?
choices: That the military has ultimate authority
That all individuals and institutions are subject to and accountable to laws
That the executive branch can override the judiciary
That laws can be changed at will by the government
questions.answer: That all individuals and institutions are subject to and accountable to laws

questions.question: When did Timor-Leste gain independence?
What type of government system does Timor-Leste's constitution establish?
questions.answer: Semi-presidential

questions.question: What is a primary function of a bill of rights in a constitution?
choices: To guarantee certain inalienable rights to citizens
To define the powers of the military
questions.answer: To guarantee certain inalienable rights to citizens

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically protected by a bill of rights?
questions.answer: Right to free healthcare

questions.question: What is the primary role of the judiciary in a constitutional system?
questions.answer: To interpret and apply laws

questions.question: What does the principle of popular sovereignty assert?
choices: That the monarch has absolute power
That the military controls the government
That power ultimately resides with the people
That the judiciary is the supreme authority
questions.answer: That power ultimately resides with the people

questions.question: What is the purpose of constitutional review?
choices: To ensure laws comply with the constitution
questions.answer: To ensure laws comply with the constitution

questions.question: Which body typically has the power to declare laws unconstitutional?
questions.answer: The judiciary

questions.question: What is the primary difference between rigid and flexible constitutions?
choices: The ease of amending the constitution
questions.answer: The ease of amending the constitution

questions.question: What was a key feature of Timor-Leste's constitution-making process?
choices: It was imposed by the United Nations
It was directly copied from Portugal's constitution
questions.answer: It involved extensive public consultation

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical characteristic of a constitution?
choices: It is the supreme law of the land
It outlines the structure of government
It changes frequently to reflect current political trends
questions.answer: It changes frequently to reflect current political trends

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of separation of powers?
questions.answer: To prevent concentration of power

questions.question: In a typical presidential system, who is usually the head of state and head of government?
questions.answer: The President

questions.question: What does the term 'constitutional sovereignty' refer to?
choices: The power of the military over the constitution
The supremacy of the constitution over other laws
The ability of the executive to override the constitution
The right of citizens to ignore constitutional provisions
questions.answer: The supremacy of the constitution over other laws

questions.question: Which of the following is a key principle of constitutionalism?
questions.answer: Limited government

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a constitutional preamble?
choices: To list all laws in detail
To state the fundamental values and principles of the nation
To describe the geographical boundaries of the country
questions.answer: To state the fundamental values and principles of the nation

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically a method for amending a constitution?
questions.answer: Executive decree

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of constitutional interpretation?
choices: To apply constitutional principles to specific cases or situations
questions.answer: To apply constitutional principles to specific cases or situations

questions.question: Which of the following is a key feature of judicial independence?
choices: Judges are elected by popular vote
The executive can dismiss judges at will
Judges have fixed terms or life tenure
Judges must follow orders from the legislature
questions.answer: Judges have fixed terms or life tenure

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of a constitutional court?
choices: To review the constitutionality of laws and government actions
questions.answer: To review the constitutionality of laws and government actions

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically a fundamental right protected by constitutions?
questions.answer: Right to a specific job

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of constitutional limits on government power?
choices: To protect individual rights and prevent abuse of power
To ensure the military controls the government
questions.answer: To protect individual rights and prevent abuse of power

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the concept of 'living constitution'?
choices: A constitution that is interpreted to adapt to changing times and circumstances
A constitution written on living tissue
A constitution that only applies to living persons
questions.answer: A constitution that is interpreted to adapt to changing times and circumstances

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of constitutional provisions for emergency powers?
choices: To allow the government to ignore the constitution permanently
To provide flexibility in crisis situations while maintaining some constitutional safeguards
To give the military control over the government
To suspend all individual rights indefinitely
questions.answer: To provide flexibility in crisis situations while maintaining some constitutional safeguards

questions.question: Which of the following is a key principle of constitutional democracy?
questions.answer: Protection of minority rights
